original: For decades, Russia was known as the breadbasket of the world. With an abundance of fertile land and favorable weather conditions, the country had a near-monopoly on the global grain trade. However, the collapse of the Soviet Union in 1991 led to the liberalization of the agricultural sector, opening up the market to private enterprise. While this shift has resulted in some benefits for consumers
